# Redstone Basics

[INFO]
Welcome to the world of Minecraft redstone! This guide is perfect for beginners.
[/INFO]

## What is Redstone?

Redstone is Minecraft's version of electricity. You can use it to create:

- Automatic doors
- Lighting systems  
- Complex machines
- Logic circuits

[GALLERY]
![Redstone Dust](https://via.placeholder.com/300x200/ff0000/ffffff?text=Redstone+Dust){.medium}
![Redstone Torch](https://via.placeholder.com/300x200/ffaa00/ffffff?text=Redstone+Torch){.medium}
![Repeater](https://via.placeholder.com/300x200/888888/ffffff?text=Repeater){.medium}
[/GALLERY]

## Basic Components

[TABS]
[TAB name="(fa)bolt(/fa) Power Sources"]
### Power Sources

These components provide redstone power:

[FILETREE]
+ Power Sources
  - Redstone Torch
  - Button
  - Lever  
  - Pressure Plate
  - Daylight Sensor
[/FILETREE]
[/TAB]

[TAB name="(fa)microchip(/fa) Logic Gates"]
### Logic Gates

Create complex logic with these:

- **AND Gate**: Both inputs must be on
- **OR Gate**: Either input can be on  
- **NOT Gate**: Inverts the signal
- **XOR Gate**: Only one input can be on

[ANIMATE type="fadeIn"]
Master these and you'll be a redstone wizard!
[/ANIMATE]
[/TAB]
[/TABS]

## Your First Circuit

Let's build a simple door that opens when you step on a pressure plate:

[CODEBLOCK title="door-circuit.txt"]
```
1. Place a pressure plate in front of your door
2. Run redstone dust from the plate to the door
3. Connect the redstone to a piston or door mechanism
4. Test by stepping on the plate!
```
[/CODEBLOCK]

[WARNING]
Make sure your redstone path isn't longer than 15 blocks, or the signal will fade!
[/WARNING]
